ygData.subject: Re: Last names?
ygData.msgSnippet: Personally I agree with you. As a cleric I heal everyone for free along with any buffs provided my mana is stable and I m near healthy. In fact, the only time
ygData.messageBody:
Personally I agree with you. As a cleric I heal everyone for free along
with any buffs provided my mana is stable and I'm near healthy. In
fact, the only time I've ever received coin for my services was a soul
who needed water and I was in need of food. He gave me an article I
could sell so that my needs were met as well. I realize the AI in the
game probably doesn't have the true equivalent of Karma but near as I
can tell "what goes around comes around".

Vrachit, your humble (and slightly poor) Dwarven Cleric

--- JW IV <phule@...> wrote:
> From: JW IV <phule@...>
>
> On Wed, 21 Apr 1999, Ward Richardson wrote:
>
> > From: Ward Richardson <jonah_right_here@...>
> > Just wondering what you meant by "Almost
> Last-Named".
> > When do you reach a point where you earn such a
> thing?
>
> Lvl 20 or so I think.
>
> > Thanks,
> >
> > Crossbones the Monk, Kicking 'round in Queynos.
> >
> > P.S. -> If anyone has any spare putrid rib bones,
> it
> > would be greatly appreciated as I'm dying to get
> my
> > next quest completed ;).
>
> I can't help but feel greatly aggravated at the
> number of people who sit
> there and camp at the ruins in the hopes of taking
> advantage of monks who
> desperately need putrid rib bones. I find this
> amazingly lame. It ranks up
> there with clerics charging for heals and other such
> things.
>
> It's like a tank charging to party with you or some
> other such nonsense.
>
> Those clerics who do keep it free have my undying
> loyalty.
>
> Dirque
>
>
>
